endpoints.desc:
Invalidates an existing access token, so that it can no longer be used for
authorization. The device associated with the access token is also deleted.
`Device keys <#device-keys>`_ for the device are deleted alongside the device.

responses.description: The access token used in the request was successfully invalidated.

endpoints.title: Invalidates a user access token

endpoints.desc:
Invalidates all access tokens for a user, so that they can no longer be used for
authorization. This includes the access token that made this request. All devices
for the user are also deleted. `Device keys <#device-keys>`_ for the device are
deleted alongside the device.

This endpoint does not use the `User-Interactive Authentication API`_ because
User-Interactive Authentication is designed to protect against attacks where the
someone gets hold of a single access token then takes over the account. This
endpoint invalidates all access tokens for the user, including the token used in
the request, and therefore the attacker is unable to take over the account in
this way.

responses.description: The user's access tokens were successfully invalidated.

endpoints.title: Invalidates all access tokens for a user

info.title: Matrix Client-Server Registration and Login API

post.description:
Invalidates an existing access token, so that it can no longer be used for
authorization. The device associated with the access token is also deleted.

200.description: The access token used in the request was successfully invalidated.

post.description:
Invalidates all access tokens for a user, so that they can no longer be used for
authorization. This includes the access token that made this request. All devices
for the user are also deleted. `Device keys <#device-keys>`_ for the device are
deleted alongside the device.

This endpoint does not use the `User-Interactive Authentication API`_ because
User-Interactive Authentication is designed to protect against attacks where the
someone gets hold of a single access token then takes over the account. This
endpoint invalidates all access tokens for the user, including the token used in
the request, and therefore the attacker is unable to take over the account in
this way.

200.description: The user's access tokens were successfully invalidated.

post.summary: Invalidates all access tokens for a user

accessToken.description: The access_token returned by a call to ``/login`` or ``/register``
accessToken.name: access_token
